definition: free and at leisure (idiom); unfettered/outside the reach of the law (of criminal)/at large
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: We stood in silence watching the fish glide effortlessly.
sentences.chinese: 我們靜靜地站着，看着魚兒逍遙自在地游來游去。

sentences.english: And althoughpoliceareconstrained by national borders, criminals roam freely.
sentences.chinese: 警察限於國境之內，罪犯卻能逍遙自在四處漫遊。

sentences.english: They jaunt about quite a lot,especially during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 他們經常逍遙自在地四處遊覽，特別是在夏天。

sentences.english: She is an easygoing, frank and open-minded girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個逍遙自在的，坦白的和虛心的少女。

sentences.english: Mr. Tapley appeared to be taking his ease on the landing of the first floor.
sentences.chinese: 塔普利先生想必正逍遙自在地在二樓的樓梯口歇着呢。
